word: AS FAR BACK AS THE MIDDLE 1870S, MRS. WHITE GAVE COUNSEL AGAINST COLONIZATION OF PEOPLE AND INSTITUTIONS RESULTING IN CONSOLIDATION AND CENTRALIZATION OF POWER--SPECIFICALLY, IN BATTLE CREEK. WRITING TO O. A. OLSEN, PRESIDENT OF THE GENERAL CONFERENCE, SHE STATED IN 1896 THAT "TWENTY YEARS AGO" SHE HAD BEEN SHOWN THAT THE PUBLISHING HOUSE ON THE PACIFIC COAST "WAS EVER TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT OF ALL OTHER INSTITUTIONS; THAT IT WAS TO BE CONTROLLED BY NO OTHER INSTITUTION." SHE WENT ON TO SAY:
